Comment: This command info is generated from fig
Name: nativescript
Description: The NativeScript CLI lets you create, build, and deploy NativeScript based apps on iOS and Android devices

Arguments.Name: -v
Arguments.Description: View your current Nativescript CLI version

Arguments.Name: help
Arguments.Description: Open the CLI's documentation in your web browser

Arguments.Name: --help
Arguments.Description: Show help for the help subcommand

Arguments.Name: info
Arguments.Description: Displays version information about the NativeScript CLI, core modules, and runtimes

Arguments.Description: Show help for the info subcommand

Arguments.Name: update
Arguments.Description: Updates the project with the latest versions of platform runtimes, cross-platform modules and webpack

Arguments.Description: Show help for the update subcommand

Arguments.Name: version
Arguments.Description: version

Arguments.Name: next
Arguments.Description: The latest development release

Arguments.Description: Show help for the package-manager subcommand

Arguments.Name: get
Arguments.Description: Prints the value of the current package manager

Arguments.Name: set
Arguments.Description: Enables the specified package manager for the NativeScript CLI. Supported values are npm, yarn and pnpm

Arguments.Name: doctor
Arguments.Description: Checks your system for configuration problems which might prevent the NativeScript CLI from working properly for the specified platform, if configured

Arguments.Name: --help
Arguments.Description: Show help for the doctor subcommand

Arguments.Name: android
Arguments.Description: Check your system configuration for android

Arguments.Name: ios

Arguments.Name: migrate
Arguments.Description: Migrates the app dependencies to a form compatible with NativeScript 6.0

Arguments.Name: --help
Arguments.Description: Show help for the migrate subcommand

Arguments.Name: usage-reporting
Arguments.Description: Configures anonymous usage reporting for the NativeScript CLI. All data gathered is used strictly for improving the product and will never be used to identify or contact you

Arguments.Name: --help
Arguments.Description: Show help for the usage-reporting subcommand

Arguments.Name: status
Arguments.Description: Shows the current configuration for anonymous usage reporting for the NativeScript CLI

Arguments.Name: enable
Arguments.Description: Enables anonymous usage reporting

Arguments.Name: disable
Arguments.Description: Disables anonymous usage reporting

Arguments.Name: error-reporting
Arguments.Description: Configures anonymous error reporting for the NativeScript CLI. All data gathered is used strictly for improving the product and will never be used to identify or contact you

Arguments.Description: Show help for the error-reporting subcommand

Arguments.Name: status
Arguments.Description: Shows the current configuration for anonymous error reporting for the NativeScript CLI

Arguments.Name: enable
Arguments.Description: Enables anonymous error reporting

Arguments.Name: disable
Arguments.Description: Disables anonymous error reporting

Arguments.Name: proxy
Arguments.Description: Displays the current proxy settings of the NativeScript CLI

Arguments.Name: --help
Arguments.Description: Show help for the proxy subcommand

Arguments.Name: clear
Arguments.Description: Clears the currently configured proxy settings of the NativeScript CLI

Arguments.Name: set
Arguments.Description: Sets the proxy settings of the NativeScript CLI

Arguments.Name: --insecure

Arguments.Description: proxy url

Arguments.Description: username

Arguments.Description: password

Arguments.Description: Specifies the directory where you want to create the project, if different from the current directory. <directory> is the absolute path to an empty directory in which you want to create the project

Arguments.Name: directory
Arguments.Description: directory

Arguments.Name: --appid
Arguments.Description: Sets the application identifier of your project. <appid> is the value of the application identifier and it must meet the specific requirements of each platform that you want to target. If not specified, the application identifier is set to org.nativescript.<Project Name>. The application identifier must be a domain name in reverse

Arguments.Description: identifier

Arguments.Description: Produces a QR code which can be used to preview the app on a device

Arguments.Description: Skips the application compatibility checks and forces npm i to ensure all dependencies are installed

Arguments.Description: Disables Hot Module Replacement (HMR)

Arguments.Name: run
Arguments.Description: Runs your project on all connected devices or in native emulators for the selected platform

Arguments.Name: --env.aot
Arguments.Description: Creates an Ahead-Of-Time build (Angular only)

Arguments.Name: --env.uglify
Arguments.Description: Provides basic obfuscation and smaller app size

Arguments.Name: --env.report
Arguments.Description: Creates a Webpack report inside a /report folder in the root folder

Arguments.Name: --env.sourceMap
Arguments.Description: Creates inline source maps

Arguments.Name: --env.hiddenSourceMap
Arguments.Description: Creates sources maps in the root folder (useful for Crashlytics usage with bundled app in release)

Arguments.Name: --env.verbose
Arguments.Description: Prints verbose logs and the internal config before building

Arguments.Name: --env.production
Arguments.Description: Enable production mode (will minify the code)

Arguments.Name: --env.replace=from:to
Arguments.Description: Add file replacement rules. For source files (.js and .ts) this will add a new alias to the config, for everything else, this will add a new copy rule

Arguments.Name: --no-hmr
Arguments.Description: Disables Hot Module Replacement (HMR)

Arguments.Name: --force
Arguments.Description: Skips the application compatibility checks and forces npm i to ensure all dependencies are installed

Arguments.Name: --device
Arguments.Description: Specifies a connected device/emulator to start and run the app

Arguments.Name: device id
Arguments.Description: device id

Arguments.Name: --clean
Arguments.Description: Forces rebuilding the native application

Arguments.Name: --emulator
Arguments.Description: Specifies that you want to debug the app in an emulator

Arguments.Name: --timeout
Arguments.Description: Sets the number of seconds that the NativeScript CLI will wait for the debugger to boot. If not set, the default timeout is 90 seconds

Arguments.Name: seconds
Arguments.Description: seconds

Arguments.Name: --justlaunch
Arguments.Description: Does not print the application output in the console

Arguments.Name: --release
Arguments.Description: Produces a release build by running webpack in production mode and native build in release mode. Otherwise, produces a debug build

Arguments.Description: Bundle the application

Arguments.Description: Add file replacement rules. For source files (.js and .ts) this will add a new alias to the config, for everything else, this will add a new copy rule

Arguments.Name: --release
Arguments.Description: Produces a release build by running webpack in production mode and native build in release mode. Otherwise, produces a debug build

Arguments.Name: --copy-to
Arguments.Description: Specifies the file path where the built .ipa|.apk will be copied. If it points to a non-existent directory path, it will be created. If the specified value is existing directory, the original file name will be used

Arguments.Name: path
Arguments.Description: path

Arguments.Name: --path
Arguments.Description: Specifies the directory where you want to create the project, if different from the current directory

Arguments.Name: directory
Arguments.Description: directory

Arguments.Description: Skips the application compatibility checks and forces npm i to ensure all dependencies are installed

Arguments.Name: --clean
Arguments.Description: Forces rebuilding the native application

Arguments.Name: --device
Arguments.Description: Specifies a connected device/emulator to start and run the app

Arguments.Name: device id
Arguments.Description: device id

Arguments.Name: --aab
Arguments.Description: Specifies that the command will produce and deploy an Android App Bundle

Arguments.Name: --env.snapshot
Arguments.Description: Creates a V8 Snapshot decreasing the app start time (only for release builds for Android)

Arguments.Name: --env.compileSnapshot
Arguments.Description: Compiles the static assets produced by --env.snapshot into .so files allowing the native build to split them per architecture. This will reduce the app size when using the --aab option

Arguments.Name: --env.appComponents
Arguments.Description: Allows passing additional App Components for android

Arguments.Description: Sets the Android SDK that will be used to build the project

Arguments.Name: --for-device

Arguments.Name: --i-cloud-container-environment
Arguments.Description: Adds the passed iCloudContainerEnvironment when exporting an application package with the --for-device option

Arguments.Name: --team-id
Arguments.Description: If used without parameter, lists all team names and ids. If used with team name or id, it will switch to automatic signing mode and configure the .xcodeproj file of your app. In this case .xcconfig should not contain any provisioning/team id flags

Arguments.Name: team id
Arguments.Description: team id

Arguments.Name: --provision
Arguments.Description: If used without parameter, lists all eligible provisioning profiles. If used with UUID or name of your provisioning profile, it will switch to manual signing mode and configure the .xcodeproj file of your app

Arguments.Name: uuid
Arguments.Description: uuid
